column1: Table 4.1a: Total quantities of food consumed (grams) per day: male (including non-consumers), by age (Years 12 to 15 combined)
This worksheet contains one table. Some cells refer to notes which can be found at the bottom of this table.
National Diet and Nutrition Survey. Results from Years 12 to 15 (2019 to 2023).
Blank cells occur in rows 8, 27, 40, 48, 62, 68, 82, 86, 90, 95 and 100 where quantities of food consumed are not presented for combined food groups.
Buns, cakes, pastries and fruit pies
Milk and milk products and alternatives
Plant-based flavoured milk and cream alternatives
Yogurt, fromage frais and dairy desserts
Bacon, ham and other processed red meat
Beef and beef products and dishes
Lamb and lamb products and dishes
Pork and pork products and dishes
Offal and offal products and dishes
Sausages and sausage products and dishes
Game and game products and dishes
Shellfish and shellfish products and dishes
Vegetables and vegetable products and dishes
Pulse and legume products and dishes
Potato, starchy root and tuber products and dishes
Other processed fruits and fruit products
Fruit and vegetable juices and smoothies
Savoury sauces, spices, condiments and cooking ingredients
Meal replacements, nutrition powders and drinks
Please refer to Appendix R for a full description of food groups.
Some food groups are not included due to small numbers of consumers.
Due to small numbers of consumers, formula, baby milks and baby foods have not been split by sex and are only provided in sex combined table 4.1c.

All sandwich code selections, homemade or retail, are included in the sandwich food group, but if a participant uses the sandwich builder then the individual components are reported under the individual food groups.
Some oils which are used as a condiment on bread or salads are included in this food group; however this food group does not include oils or fats used in cooking.
Not including sugar-free confectionery. This is not reported separately due to very small numbers of consumers.
Non-alcoholic beverages are reported as consumed with diluent water.
Some dry powders are included in this food group; in which case the water component is included in the ‘Tea, coffee and water’ food group.
Usual Intake values could not be calculated for all food groups so for consistency Day Average values have been calculated for all food groups within this table.
